Hi guys. 

 

I just reinstalled KSP, modded it with all 1.0.5 stuff. Not much though

but aestetically i use EVE and scatterer, planetshine, distant object and texture replacer...

 

When i am going up into the sky and beyond i notice a weird black line hugging the horizon, it's thin and is badly aliased... was wondering if i did something wrong, or if that is a normal "bug".

Here's the link: (click to enlarge)

 

Also.

- I could'nt use the cast shadow options of scatterer because i see weird grid/hatch like shadows which seem to move when i move...

- I could'nt use godrays because i see a long black line from rocket debris fallen of stage parts under me across the whole globe..

more explanation
Looks a lot like a simple graphics glitch. You could try adjusting your antialias settings to see if that helps.

I tried changing it. I use the x8 setting and have smooth gameplay. Changing it around didn't help though. What i noticed is when i use the scatterer mod the horizon and mountain ridges are not aliased. and it seems that that is causing the black line you see here too. Because i just deleted scatterer to test and you could'nt see the dotted line anymore. Same for the mountains, those were back to aliased form..

 

Shame, how does this happen? i LOVE the scatterer mod, so much atmosphere!!!
I am having the exact same issue. Can't really find any more info.
